description: Increased risk of severe bleeding when taken together. Both medications thin the blood and interfere with cladding.
advice: Do not take together. Consult your doctor immediately to adjust doses or switch medications.

description: Risk of lactic acidosis, a serious metabolic complication. Kidney function must be assessed.
advice: Stop metformin 48 hours before and after imaging procedures requiring contrast dye.

description: NSAIDs can reduce the blood pressure lowering effect of Lisinopril and increase risk of kidney strain.
advice: Monitor blood pressure regularly. Avoid long-term use of ibuprofen without medical supervision.

description: Amlodipine can slightly increase the levels of Simvastatin in your blood, increasing risk of muscle pain.
advice: Monitor for unusual muscle pain or weakness. Dose of Simvastatin may need adjustment.

description: Combining alcohol with paracetamol increases the risk of toxic liver damage.
advice: Avoid excessive alcohol consumption while taking paracetamol.
